subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage to DNA as a primary aging mechanism, linking metabolic rate to DNA damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on oxidative damage causing mitochondrial DNA deletions contributing to muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hydroxyl radical-induced oxidative DNA damage activating senescence pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress to telomere shortening and DNA damage accelerating aging in ectotherms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative DNA damage and mutations driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress causing DNA damage contributing to neuronal degeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Driven Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage including DNA and lipid peroxidation as aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing mtDNA mutations and stem cell dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as primary source of oxidative damage and aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links metabolic rate, mitochondrial ROS production, and caloric restriction effects on aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes longevity determined by rate of mitochondrial free radical generation and co-evolution of antioxidant capacity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction as source of ROS driving aging and free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links metabolic rate, mitochondrial ROS production, and membrane composition affecting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on antioxidant enzymes and mitochondrial ROS detoxification influencing maximum lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes antioxidant enzymes modulating free radical damage and aging, with dietary restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on antioxidant enzymes like SOD1 in reducing ROS and extending lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in antioxidant capacity and role of antioxidant enzymes in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights antioxidant defenses and repair mechanisms mitigating free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details antioxidant enzyme efficiency and their role in protecting cells from free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on regional antioxidant enzyme activity and oxidative damage in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes glutathione deficiency impairing antioxidant defense leading to oxidative stress and premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glutathione as critical antioxidant whose decline with age contributes to oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Free Radical Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes oxidative damage accumulation due to insufficient antioxidant defense as primary aging cause.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Membrane Composition Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on lipid peroxidation susceptibility modulated by fatty acid unsaturation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on selective oxidative damage to mitochondrial proteins contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of oxidatively damaged proteins as a primary driver of aging.
